definition: surname Jiang/refers to Chiang Kai-shek 蔣介石|蒋介石
grass radical 草字頭兒|草字头儿[cao3 zi4 tou2 r5]
will/shall/to use/to take/to checkmate/just a short while ago/(introduces object of main verb, used in the same way as 把[ba3])
Chiang Kai-shek (1887-1975), military leader, head of the Nationalist government in China 1928-1949 and the government in exile on Taiwan 1950-1975
Jiang Wenli (1969-), award-winning PRC film actress
Chiang Ching-kuo (1910-1988), son of Chiang Kai-shek 蔣介石|蒋介石, Guomindang politician, president of ROC 1978-1988
Chiang Wei-kuo (1916-1997), adopted son of Chiang Kai-shek 蔣介石|蒋介石
honorific title for Chiang Kai-shek 蔣介石|蒋介石[Jiang3 Jie4 shi2]
Jiang Shiquan (1725-1784), Qing poet, one of Three great poets of the Qianlong era 乾嘉三大家
confrontation of 1929 between Chiang Kaishek and the Guangxi warlord faction

sentences.english: More revealing still, the shipments were insured by Chiang's government banks.
sentences.chinese: 更妙的是，船上裝的貨都在蔣的政府銀行保了險。

sentences.english: Originally took aim at Chiang old man's wallet.
sentences.chinese: 原來是瞄上了蔣老漢的錢包。

sentences.english: Jiang Mou uses civilian battalion express delivery in Nanning, sent cogged material to Liang Mou.
sentences.chinese: 蔣某則在南寧用民營快遞，給梁某寄去了作弊器材。

sentences.english: Pai Chung-hsi and the Hupeh Provincial Council immediately brought the question of peace before the generalissimo.
sentences.chinese: 白崇禧和湖北省參議會立即向蔣提出實現和平的問題。

sentences.english: Chen Cheng, army chief of staff, declared the war would soon be over.
sentences.chinese: 蔣軍參謀總長陳誠聲言戰爭不久即可結束。

sentences.english: They also bared the basic charlatanism underlying all of the Chiang regime's tactics.
sentences.chinese: 這些事實也暴露了蔣政權各種手法的卑鄙本質。

sentences.english: On March 8, Chiang's troops arrived in Keelung and that night entered the capital of Taipeh.
sentences.chinese: 三月八日，蔣軍開抵基隆，當晚進入省城臺北。

sentences.english: Thus, another element of decay was introduced into Chiang's power.
sentences.chinese: 它成了使蔣政權一蹶不振的一個新因素。

sentences.english: In the same way, Chiang hated foreigners even while he depended on them.
sentences.chinese: 同樣，蔣儘管依賴洋人，卻也憎恨洋人。

sentences.english: There is talk of removing Chiang's portrait from Taiwanese coins.
sentences.chinese: 也有將老蔣圖像從臺灣錢幣拿掉的說法。

sentences.english: Pai and his associates wanted to get rid of Chiang in order to save something from the wreck of Kuomintang power.
sentences.chinese: 白及其同夥想要除掉蔣，使國民黨政權得以苟延殘喘。

sentences.english: DengJiu light for dragon bacc the let JiangXiaoYu three people back to the beast camp, the dragon bacc the promise.
sentences.chinese: 鄧久光求龍百川讓蔣小魚三人回獸營，龍百川答應。

sentences.english: Chiang's officers and soldiers in Fuhsun city were very arrogant.
sentences.chinese: 蔣軍官兵在撫順飛揚跋扈。

sentences.english: The instructor demonstrates how to belay and safety knots used.
sentences.chinese: 指導員蔣示範如何把繩索拴在繫繩索和系安全扣等。

sentences.english: But in the end to feather down pistol, choose to JiangXiaoYu and LuYan cooperation.
sentences.chinese: 但最終向羽放下了信號槍，選擇跟蔣小魚和魯炎合作。

sentences.english: Chiang's movements were now those of an animal in a cage.
sentences.chinese: 蔣的這些活動不過是因獸猶鬥。

definition: surname Wu/area comprising southern Jiangsu, northern Zhejiang and Shanghai/name of states in Southern China at different historical periods
to gallop/to assist/to attack/to wade/great/old variant of 憑|凭[ping2]
Zheng state during the Warring States period/surname Zheng/abbr. for 鄭州|郑州[Zheng4 zhou1]
surname Zou/vassal state during the Zhou Dynasty (1046-256 BC) in the southeast of Shandong Province
surname Zhao/one of the seven states during the Warring States Period (476-220 BC)/the Former Zhao 前趙 (304-329) and Later Zhao 後趙 (319-350), states of the Sixteen Kingdoms
(classical) a type of battle-ax/to kill/to slaughter
pitchpipe, pitch standard, one of the twelve semitones in the traditional tone system
